meanings.definition: To honor or esteem too highly.
meanings.sent1: She overhonored her favorite teacher by giving him a gift every day.
meanings.sent2: The community overhonored the local hero with a parade and a statue in the town square.
meanings.sent3: The children overhonored their pet goldfish by throwing a birthday party for it.
meanings.sent4: The artist overhonored the canvas with so many layers of paint that it became a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef overhonored the simple dish by adding expensive truffles and gold leaf.

meanings.definition: To show excessive respect or admiration for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He overhonored his boss by constantly praising her work, even when it was not exceptional.
meanings.sent2: The fans overhonored the celebrity by camping outside her house for days just to catch a glimpse of her.
meanings.sent3: The dog overhonored its owner by bringing them a stick every time they came home, thinking it was a valuable gift.
meanings.sent4: The student overhonored the teacher by writing a 10-page essay about their greatness.
meanings.sent5: The gardener overhonored the flowers by watering them three times a day, causing them to wilt from too much moisture.
